Header: Last year’s runner up de Minaur starts Next Gen Finals campaign with win
Content: World number 18 and top seed Alex de Minaur began his Next Gen ATP Finals campaign with a hard fought 4-2 3-4 4-1 4-1 victory over Alejandro Davidovich Fokina in Milan, Italy. De Minaur, last year’s runner up and the only returning player to the season-ending tournament that pits the best eight players aged 21 or younger against one another, won eight of the last nine games to seal victory. Serbian Miomir Kecmanovic, ranked 60th in the world, defeated Norwegian Casper Ruud 4-3, 4-3, 4-2 in the opening match of the tournament.
